intro: Xylopia beccarii, commonly known as the African allspice, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, rough bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by round, woody fruits containing several seeds. The fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to its strong, spicy aroma. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
